Despite being ridiculously full, we did order the black forrest cheesecake which was DIVINE!! Our service was prompt, professional and courteous. We will definitely be back for more!!
A Wonderful Place made so, not only be truly excellent food, but also by Outstanding Service.  Great Italian dishes with homemade pasta and wonderful sauces. We be back!

Our server was amazing! You can definitely tell that this place is family owned but with an intimate setting! Our server had great recommendations and even told us about a Groupon deal that they were offering. Great drinks and food was well priced! I had the shrimp scampi and it was delicious! Will be back here for sure!

Heard good things about here, saw a deal on amazon so thought we would try it.  They charge me $2 extra for my kettle one served ice. Cheese and meat plate had one slice of salami slice up in little slivers, a few cheeses, some were dried out, looked like maybe left out. Had to ask for pepper and fresh parmesean, my spegghiti was over cooked and with the maranra reminded me of caned Chef Boyardee.
Amazing pizza, better than pizzeria Bianco. great wine too!!!!!!  Plus live music. So much fun.

#100 for 2013! Woot! Anyway, I went to SOLO for my birthday dinner with my mom and it was very good! We shared the funghi pizza and the pasta with the nettle pesto. The pizza was great, it was fresh and earthy. It had a pancetta agrodulce on it, which was good, kind of like a dressing, but I thought it would have had pieces of pancetta on it. The pasta was also very good, the pesto was delicious and the peas were fresh. We shared a bottle of delicious moscato d'asti, half priced because it was Wednesday, and for dessert we had the budino which was nice and tasted like nutella and was very tasty. On top of all that, the prices were very reasonable. I had plenty of food for lunch for 2 days after the meal. I would definitely come back to SOLO again!!!

I LOVE this place.  It is in a strange location--on the first floor of the Esplanade--below the AMC movie theatre, but it is well worth seeking out.  There's something so great about supporting a local business that features notes on the menu like, "Mom's favorite" or a cocktail named for one of the brothers.   We had:  bruschetta (so interesting--eggplant was something I'd never seen on one before), mushroom/shrimp risotto and pizza.  In this town, a lot of people can do amazing pizza... and Solo is certainly among them.   Go go go!  Support local, family-owned business.

The menu here is exquisite and never disappoints, however our service tonight was less than impressive. We had reservations for 8 pm, but due to construction in the plaza {not mentioned by the host when making our reservation} we ending up being 20 minutes late for our reservation. We did call and let the restaurant know we were running late. When we arrived our server, Hilary, went to take our drink and appetizer order before 2 of our party of 6 settled in. After appetizers she said "you need to hurry up and order entrees before the kitchen closes". It was 8:25, and the restaurant advertises being open until 9 pm. After taking our rushed dinner orders, Hilary continued to rush our dessert order. We felt very I unwelcomed and rushed and have never had this kind of experience at Solo. After having frequented this restaurant and always been impressed, we decided whole walking in, that we were going to tip our server $100 because 1) we were late for our reservation 2) we had a groupon for $300 worth of food for which we paid $150 3) we were dining there after a very expensive failed Vegas trip for the weekend and 4) I am a server myself, and have beat tipping 20% into my family's head. Being a server, I do understand the frustration that comes with guests walking in 10 even 15 minutes before close, however we were there in ample time to eat and be out of the restaurant 15 minutes after close. We ended up tipping Hilary 16%, which we thought was more than deserving. We will certainly return to Solo, however, we will be sure to request a sever other than Hilary.

Service was superb by one of the managers named drew. Started with the caprese appetizer which is a must have due to its 3 different types of heirloom tomatoes with burrata and mozzarella cheese. He suggested the shrimp scampi and it was a great blend of spice and cream. I highly suggest to sit near the bar which has been conveniently built out for viewing of any sporting event. 5 stars in my book!

SOLO does an AMAZING job of service, quality local seasonal ingredients, and expert execution.  We had 2 different pizzas (fabulous), meatballs, burrata, asparagus wrapped in prosciutto with fondue cheese (outstanding), rigatoni (the only pasta not house made), flat-iron steak (perfect) and olives (amazingly delicious). The pizza was perfectly cooked, great crispy/chewy crust, flavorful cheese, quality meats, and perfect amount of sauce.  The meatballs were a good size, good quality meat, but a touch too much oregano that took over a little too much of the flavor.  Also, while the tomato sauce was tasty, it could use a minor tweak, maybe a few tomato chunks? I'm sure this is a matter of preference, the sauce has a good flavor, but maybe too much of a puree consistency. The burrata was delicious but could use a sprinkle of sea salt.  While I'm on the subject, since SOLO has such high quality ingredients, ditch the standard salt shaker, and use little bowls of sea salt w/ a tiny spoon.  It's a touch we expect from a quality establishment like this. The grilled asparagus with prosciutto is out of this world good.  BRAVO!  The rigatoni is just ok, but it's their only pasta not house made.  It was a little dry and boring, but ok.  The flat iron steak was perfectly cut, seasoned, and grilled.  It's accompanying arugula salad was fresh and flavorful but I think accidentally salted twice.  Nothing else was over salted, but this dish.  The marinated olives had fantastic flavor picked up from the fresh herb marinade. The atmosphere is pleasant, but too non-descript.  I think this town is starving for more restaurants with atmosphere that has character and charm ala The Parlor and Postino.  The use of recycled wood, cool light fixtures, and some whimsical touches would go a long way here.   The wait staff was fantastic.  One of the owners, John, came by the table.  He was nice, passionate, and genuine. They were offering a free app or dessert to Iron Man movie goers.  I thought it was a great way to bring in new customers, but they need a board that can also face the East/West direction so people can see this coming off the elevators.  Their happy hour is also fantastic.  Most everything under $7 and all delicious. I'm glad you are here SOLO!!  Keep up the good work!!

Management refused to honor coupon which inconveniently expired on a day during which the restaurant was closed.  Really? Why lose customers permanently over a $15 coupon?  Why not just honor the coupon and avoid the bad rep?    SOLO, if you don't like honoring coupons, stop flooding the internet with them.  Don't blame the customers after you've closed up shop and avoided them.  Summary:  Friendly waitstaff, cosy atmosphere, but only one or two tasty items on menu.  Moreover, owners need to reassess approach to honoring coupons which have been purchased by customers and often expire on SOLO holidays.
Excellent pork belly!  The food was outstanding and the service was friendly and attentive. This restaurant is a terrific addition to the Phoenix marketplace.

We ate their twice and both times had serious red flags and worse. Perhaps my wife would say only one star for Solo Trattoria. On the first visit the waitress had bold face lied and told us their food was organic and non-gmo. We researched later and found they are neither. At both visits I had indigestion- it was light, but I haven't had it in many years. They add chemicals and heap on unhealthy ingredients to improve the richness and taste of their food- and we are in the position to know!! We will never return to this so-called italian gourmet restaurant.Their food is dirty and very suspicious. Giving two stars for the ambiance and the price we paid thru groupon.

My son & I eat here as often as possible.  The food is literally out of this world.  The staff is extremely kind and considerate they treat you like family. We have had an excellent meal each and every time we have come. Whether it has been a mix of kids and adults,  just my son and I or just myself and some business associates.  Solo Trattoria is one of the best places I have ever eaten - highly recommend for anyone!!!

The place offered enclosed parking on the back and it is situated in one of the most magnificent play space in the city.  Very friendly server introduced himself and gives great impression and service standsrds.  The problem came with my plate where the freshness of seafood is questionable so I ended up with cramps all night long.  My friends Salmon was cooked to perfection garnish with cook beans and Brussel sprouts.  The Cheese cake and tiramisu was heavenly.  He forgot our coffee order but apologize right away.  Would have earned a five star if I didn't feel ill.  Had to take a immodium AD to sleep with gas all night long.  Next time I probably won't order seafood since we are hundreds  miles away from ocean.  Will return soon.

If you are looking for an intimate and romantic Italian night out, this is your place!  We came on a Saturday night and they had live music - a lady playing cover songs on acoustic guitar.  While it was a little awkward towards the end of the night (bc the restaurant was pretty much empty and there were only 2 tables left) it was still nice to hear her play.  We came here with a voucher deal for a price-fixe menu, so we got to share an appetizer, pick two entrees, and share a dessert.  (it also came with after dinner shots but we skipped those...).  For our appetizer we ordered the "simple salad" which was exactly what it sounded like.  Basically just greens, carrots, and croutons in a balsamic vinaigrette dressing.  I enjoyed it.  For my entree I ordered the shrimp scampi.  It came with thick, flat noodles in an orange-colored cream sauce.  It was slightly spicy, but not overpowering.  I really liked the dish, but I would have liked it more if my noodles had been cooked just a BIT longer.  They were slightly hard and not cooked enough.  I still finished almost the whole dish.  Dessert was their special for the night, a turtle cheesecake.  It was moist, thick, creamy.  Just what you'd want and expect in a cheesecake!  My biggest gripe is that their menu needs better descriptions of the entrees.  Most of the entrees just have the Italian name, with very little detail.  For example, "Chicken Ciambotta" is listed under "pasta" but it's actually a type of stew and it comes out with NO pasta in it.  I had to google most of the names of the entrees to try and figure out what they were.  I understand I could ask our server, but I would've had to ask him for like 10 different descriptions, and I didn't feel like doing that.

This was a Groupon find and I am glad we found it. First off, getting in was not easy. We ended up parking at the mall and walking.   The food was amazing. My wife is normally so-so with meat and cheese plates but even she enjoyed everything on that app. The pizza was among the best we've had in the valley. The deserts were generous though not huge.  Now for what really stood out. The service. Our waiter was the most helpful I've ever met in a restaurant. He gave us advice but was not just pushing the expensive items. He was always there when we wanted a refill or had a question but was never there when we just wanted to talk.  There was live music and the singer was good and fit the ambiance of the restaurant perfectly. Overall it was a prefer dinner out to relax and enjoy some great food. This was one of those times that Groupon put a place on our radar for the next time we are across town.
Decent food...but not great, considering its high prices.

Loved it so much I went back last night. I had the Spaghetti squash with Salmon. It was an amazing no-wheat dinner. I finished it off with a three-flavor cheesecake that was so good I wanted to take it home for my family. Unfortunately, I live about an hour away by plane, so that didn't happen. :)  Excellent food, friendly staff, what more could I want?

Ridiculous amazing service. The owner came and talked with us as he had a boatload of complimentary appetizers brought out. Family owned and almost all of the food is locally sourced with sausage from Schreiners and beef from neiman ranch. Food was delicious and carefully made. A great phoenix addition!

I went about 15 minutes before closing time on a Friday night. The crowd had definitely dwindled. The maitre de was really nice and so was my waiter. The wine was exquisite. My pizza was ho-hum, and that's really why I went. I'd been craving pizza all week long and this was my splurge. I probably would've been just as happy (if not happier) with Dominos. Maybe next time I'll try the pasta. I'm sure it will be out of this world. Very nice setting, very nice staff. I'll go back, but I'll order something other than the pepperoni pizza.

The food here was excellent and the prices reasonable. We had the cheese board, the rigatoni, and the frutti di mare, and everything was delicious. The service was good as well. I think this is a great restaurant that just needs to match its ambiance to its menu and make the decor a little classier.

The meatball sub is the best I have had in Az so far. The service was outstanding. I sat at the bar and talked with the owner. My server was the best! I can't wait to go back. I hope they do well at this location.

This was a delight in every regard.  The décor is contemporary and upbeat.  The cuisine amazing.  We started out with the salmon cakes in a sweet chili sauce delicious!  The main course was eggplant parma which was cooked to perfection and melted in our mouths.  We ordered a bottle of Italian wine it was a blend and perfect with our meal! Adriana our server was very well versed on all menu items and her personable service was the icing on the cake!  I am from the LA area of California and there is no shortage of great cuisine but this certainly was comparable or better!
